Docker-Flask-Template Documentation¶

Module Documentation¶

Run¶

@author : Zuicie @date : 2024-10-19

The entrypoint for starting the flask application. Ignores setting the app variable if Sphinx is building documentation.

Website Views¶

@author : Zuicie @date : 2024-10-19

website.views.api_data()¶

Returns JSON data for a given query_id. Used by the Fetch API (AJAX) call in data_loader.js.

website.views.docs()¶

Serves the documentation generated by Sphinx.

Returns:

HTML documentation generated by ‘make html’.

Return type:

HTML Template

website.views.home()¶

Simple landing page that can be customized to taste. :returns: Home page. :rtype: HTML Template

website.views.serve_docs(filename)¶

Serves the auxiliary files required by the Sphinx documentation.

Parameters:

filename (path) – The path of the file needed by Sphinx.

Returns:

The file requested through docs.

Return type:

file

website.views.site_map()¶

HTML page that contains a table with all links that don’t require parameters. :returns: Contains a table that displays the sitemap. :rtype: HTML Template

website.views.switch_theme(theme)¶

Allows the user to switch between default Bootswatch Themes. :param theme: String of theme to load.

Returns:

Redirect to source or home

Auth Views¶

@author : Zuicie @date : 2024-10-20

website.auth.forgot_password()¶

Returns:

website.auth.generate_reset_token(user_id, expires_sec=1800)¶

Generate a token that expires after 30 minutes (1800 seconds) :param user_id: The id of the user requesting a password reset. :param expires_sec: How long to allow the link to persist for.

Returns:

Serialized token that has been salted for user reset functions.

website.auth.login()¶

Allows the user to authenticate with unique credentials.

website.auth.logout()¶

Logs the user out and returns them to the home page. :returns: Redirect to auth.login.

website.auth.profile()¶

Handles user account and profile information. Mostly for allowing user to change password. :returns: HTML template for profile page, profile.html

website.auth.reset_password(token)¶
Parameters:

token

Returns:

website.auth.show_users()¶

Shows a list of all users in the system, loaded into a dynamically generated table through data_loader.js. :returns: Table with all users.

website.auth.signup()¶

Allows a new user to register with the application.

website.auth.verify_reset_token(token, max_age=1800)¶

Verify token within 30 minutes (1800 seconds). :param token: The token to verify. :param max_age: The maximum age the token can be.

Returns:

user_id or None

Test Routes¶

@author : Zuicie @date : November 19, 2024 Actual test functions for pytest.

tests.test_routes.new_user(db)¶

Create a new user for testing.

tests.test_routes.test_api_data_no_config(client)¶

If query_config doesn’t exist for the given query_id

tests.test_routes.test_api_data_no_query_id(client)¶

Query /api/data with no query id. Should return an empty response.

tests.test_routes.test_api_data_valid(client, db, new_user)¶

Create a QueryConfiguration that returns the user, then fetch the query_id from api/data.

tests.test_routes.test_forgot_password_get(client)¶

Ensure GET /forgot-password renders the form.

tests.test_routes.test_forgot_password_post_doesnt_exist(client, monkeypatch)¶

Test POST /forgot-password with a non-existent user email.

tests.test_routes.test_forgot_password_post_exists(client, new_user, monkeypatch)¶

Test POST /forgot-password with a valid user email.

tests.test_routes.test_home_page(client)¶

Test that the homepage is accessible.

tests.test_routes.test_login(client, new_user)¶

Test user login.

tests.test_routes.test_logout(client, new_user)¶

Test user logout.

tests.test_routes.test_password_change(client, new_user)¶

Test password change.

tests.test_routes.test_profile_access(client, new_user)¶

Test accessing the profile page when logged in.

tests.test_routes.test_profile_requires_login(client)¶

Test that profile page redirects when not logged in.

tests.test_routes.test_reset_password_get_valid_token(client, new_user, app)¶

Test GET /reset-password/<token> with a valid token

tests.test_routes.test_reset_password_invalid_token(client)¶

Test GET /reset-password/<token> with invalid/expired token.

tests.test_routes.test_reset_password_post_valid_token(client, new_user, app)¶

Test POST /reset-password/<token> to actually change the password.

tests.test_routes.test_signup(client)¶

Test user registration.
